title: Recommender System Attribution with TracIn
text:
Introduction
TracIn computes the influence of a training instance on a prediction made by the model. The method estimates the change in test loss when the training instance of interest is used to update model weights (Pruthi et al. 2020).


Limitations and future work
To achieve meaningful performance gains, a non trivial amount of data has to be removed.
Thus, for some items, the recommender system is unable to learn meaningful relationships with user history.








References

Pruthi, Garima, Frederick Liu, Satyen Kale, and Mukund Sundararajan. 2020. “Estimating Training Data Influence by Tracing Gradient Descent.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 33: 19920–30.
